name: Certainty
description:
USE ARROW KEYS TO MOVE AND GO THROUGH DIALOGUE

Gameplay is literally straightforward. 

This is a work of interactive fiction documenting the stream of consciousness of one Aztec warrior.

Special thanks to my mother for being my playtester as well as Dr. Kosiba and Mr. Rodríguez Osorio for being excellent teachers.

Game made possible by Bitsy

Listed below are the references I used for research.

Amlin, Patricia, director. 1996. The Five Suns: A Sacred History of Mexico. Berkeley Media. 54 minutes.

Brumfield, Elizabeth M. 1998. “Huitzilopochtli's Conquest: Aztec Ideology in the Archaeological Record.” Cambridge Archaeological Journal 8 (1): 3-13. doi:10.1017/S095977430000127X

Carrasco, Davíd. 1990. Religions of Mesoamerica: Cosmovision and Ceremonial Centers. San Francisco, CA: Harper & Row.

Elzey, Wayne. 1991. “A Hill on a Land Surrounded by Water: An Aztec Story of Origin and Destiny.” History of Religions 31 (2): 105-149. jstor.org/stable/1063021.

Evans, Susan T. 2017. “Aztec Gambling and Magical Thinking.”  In Prehistoric Games of North American Indians, edited by Barbara Voorhies, 259-272. Salt Lake City, UT: University of Utah Press.

León-Portilla, Miguel. 1963. Aztec Thought and Culture: A Study of the Ancient Náhuatl Mind. Translated by Jack E. Davis. Norman, OK: University of Oklahoma Press.

Kendrick, Dolores. 1965. “Aspects of Aztec Poetry.” Books Abroad 39 (3): 269-273. jstor.org/stable/40119812. Smith, Michael E. 2012. The Aztecs. 3rd ed. West Sussex, UK: Wiley-Blackwell. ePDF.
